html.p: Data Collection: Tenable data is necessary to collect the vulnerability scan results and host summaries. This data can be acquired via the Tenable Add-On for Splunk.
The data check for the table below is for the last seven days. The data for this table is loaded from the KV store lookup.

search.query: `cs_tenable` | stats count, latest(_time) as "Last Event" | eval data_report=if(count>0, "Data Present", "Data Not Present"), label="`cs_tenable`" | eval "Last Event"=if(count=0, " - ", strftime('Last Event', "%F %T")) | table label, "Last Event", data_report | append [| rest /servicesNS/-/cyences_app_for_splunk/saved/searches count=0 splunk_server=local | search "eai:acl.app"="cyences_app_for_splunk" title IN ("Device Inventory - Tenable", "Device Inventory - Tenable Vuln") | table title, disabled | rename title as label | eval data_report=if(disabled=1, "Report is disabled", "Report is enabled"), "Last Event"="N/A"] | table label, "Last Event", data_report

format.colorPalette: {"Data Present": #03991a, "Data Not Present": #a3030b, "Report is enabled": #03991a, "Report is disabled": #a3030b}

search.query: | stats sum(inbound_traffic) as inbound_traffic, sum(outbound_traffic) as outbound_traffic by vul_ip, vul_port | sort - inbound_traffic, - outbound_traffic
